subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: Frank Ratka
full_text:
--0-702625118-1244552742=:52269
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

The name aether is sometimes still used but now it is called cosmic backgro=
und radiation, primordial energy gradient=A0or more recently the zero-point=
 field. The only way it can be proven to exist is in reference to accelerat=
ion. The zero-point field is theories to penetrate all things accept for a =
charged medium, which instead gives you a distortion field in the zero-poin=
t field we call a magnetic field. The zero-point field is the "canvas" that=
 the universe and all matter is painted on. It is the only thing that still=
 oscillates at absolute zero when all other systems cease to move. This osc=
illation is called a funny word called "zitterbewegung" motion.
=A0
Of cour=
se all this is theorized but it seems to fit the math and is being used by =
many physicists in research today in the field of quantum electrodynamics. =
Some of the researchers studying this are Dr. Harold Puthoff, Dr. Michael I=
bison, Dr. Bernard Haisch and many others who also have differing opinion o=
n howit works but not whether it exists or not. This seems to have been dee=
med, accepted theory.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo.=
com> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New idea=
s
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 4:17 PM









=



I'm not sure what you mean by "Aether".=A0 EM can propagate through a va=
cuum: it needs no medium like your other examples.=A0 It, in a sense, creat=
es its own medium as electric and magnetic forces interact with each other,=
 causing a wave in that interaction that is moving outward from the source.=
=A0 Early physics theories of something called the aether have, as far as I=
 can tell, been abandoned (it seems Einstein had a lot to do with that).


=










From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .=
com
Sent: Monday, June 8, 2009 3:43:47 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
=




You can create a wave in anything. You can create a wave in a rope by h=
aving a person hold each end and then having one person wiggle the rope. Yo=
u can create a wave in a lake by dropping a rock into it. The thing that ca=
rries the wave is the propagating medium. In these examples it's the rope a=
nd water respectively.
=A0
In the case of sound, the propagating medium is =
the air. It is a longitudinal pressure wave. It cannot be picked up on a re=
ceiver that is capable of receiving the same frequencies as electromagnetic=
 waves.
=A0
There are receivers and antennas that can pick up electromagnet=
ic waves of the same frequencies as sound waves. But in this case, the prop=
agating medium is the aether. They are transverse electromagnetic waves and=
 you can't hear them.

The electromagnetic spectrum extends from sub-audibl=
e frequencies all the way up to the frequencies of X-rays and cosmic rays. =
Different methods exist to detect or receive different parts of this spectr=
um. I'm involved in a ULF group that specializes in receiving electromagnet=
ic waves of the Schumann resonances which are around 6 Hz, plus or minus.
=
=A0
Zack
=A0

=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 2:38 PM, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii=
@ yahoo.com> wrote:













It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ...=
.."
=A0
A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking that there are two =
different types of energy at work when it comes to sound waves and electrom=
agnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is frequency and power. R=
adio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain block of the elect=
romagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just farther =
down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penetrate al=
most anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelength the =
more ways we can shield against them.
=A0
Think of microwaves. These are al=
so a type of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but the waves also have =
a physical effect on our environment by causing molecules to speed up, whic=
h creates heat. A little lower than this is IR or infrared it too can cause=
 physical objects to heat up but usually it just causes molecules to rotate=
 in place. All physical things give off IR light. Its a way the total syste=
m conserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.
=A0
Frank R. 


=
--- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com=
> wrote:



From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
=
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments] 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups =
.com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM





Here is some food for thought=
. I am currently reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.
=A0
It=
 was me and another girl teammate=A0present in the room. I picked up a 3rd =
female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. We were sta=
nding right next to another digital video recorder that I leave beside my n=
ight vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have as=
ked the girl that was with me to check her recording to see if she picked i=
t up.
=A0
I have long felt the true EVP does not come from sound waves in t=
he environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Someho=
w EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.
=A0
This instance with th=
e recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder should have picked=
 that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.
=A0
I am attachin=
g the clip of this 3rd voice. The=A0file that is named=A0"01-02-17 Clip" is=
 the full clip.=A0You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then another =
comes in right after that. I think I know what it says.
=A0
Again, I was li=
ve monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this until playback. It isn'=
t clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's from the last investig=
ation.
=A0
=A0


----- Original Message ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups .com 

Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] New ideas









I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an =
untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It =
works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that di=
ffer one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them together you=
 get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is se=
nding a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an =
untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference=
=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This=
 was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic sig=
nals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were =
generated within a few inches of the recorder.
=A0
We are able to reproduce=
 this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with a=
coustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce calle=
d the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.
=A0

Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6=
/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com> wrote:



From: Zack Widup <w9sz.z=
ack@gmail. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .c=
om
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM






Fascinating! I've had this ide=
a that the EVP are often=A0not recorded by the microphone but somehow make =
their way in at the actual=A0point where the storage is made, whether it be=
 analog (tape) or digital.=A0

So much we don't know ...
=A0
Zack

=A0

On =
Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostrese=
arch. com> wrote:










I monitor my audio live. The funny thing is tha=
t even so, those last EVP's I captured I did not hear either in the environ=
ment, or on my recording as it happened. I only heard them upon playback.
=
=A0



----- Original Message ----- 
From: Zack Widup 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoog=
roups .com 




Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]=
 New ideas





I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote =
site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.
=A0
I=A0took part in=A0an invest=
igation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six =
video cameras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all=
=A0was being monitored and recorded=A0at a central location. Alas, we did n=
ot have microphones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I=
 wonder what we might have heard if we did?
=A0
Zack

=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 20=
09 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:

=
=A0

Why don't we disc=
uss something on a lighter note? Anyone have any new ideas about either evp=
 or ITC? 
Al

<DIV>I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an untrason=
ic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It works of=
f the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one=
 another in frequency then if you add or subtract them together you get a b=
eat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a =
signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an untrason=
ic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference fre=
quency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was j=
ust an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals j=
ust by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were genera=
ted within a few inches of the recorder.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We ar=
e able to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne syst=
ems but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a comme=
rcial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>

V>I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever =
gotten any EVP in real time.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>I took part =
in an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday n=
ight. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls of the building. T=
he video for all was being monitored and recorded at a central lo=
cation. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera sites conected to t=
he central location. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?</DIV>
<DI=
V> </DIV>
